title: Team's Positions
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks BAMbot about a team's position in its division, league, or in all of baseball
OR league standings

i.e.
- Who is in first place in the AL West?
- What place are the Dodgers in?
- What place is teamName in?
- Who is in place in the divisionName?
- Who has the best record in the leagueName?
- Who has the best record in the divisionName?
- Who has the worst record in the divisionName?
- How many games back are the teamName?
custom_expected: THEN the feature should support all queries about divisions, leagues, and league-wide information.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user asks BAMbot about a team's position in its division, league, or in all of baseball
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bot replies with Division, League, MLB info

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user asks BAMbot about a team's position in the wild card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bot replies with Wild card info

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user asks BAMbot about team run differentials
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bot replies with Run differential info

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user asks BAMbot about team run differentials 
AND expected wins and losses
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bot replies with Run differential info and — if requested — what the expected win/loss should be

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user asks BAMbot about team win/loss splits for spring training, the regular season, or the postseason
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bot replies with specific team Splits info that is also found on the standings page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user asks BAMbot about team win/loss splits for spring training, the regular season, or the postseason
AND asks about specific team splits found on standings pages, including: home/away, grass/turf, day/night, vs. >.500
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN bot replies with specific team Splits info that is also found on the standing page

title: Team Division Rank Mid Season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank

i.e. What PLACE are the Yankees in?

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND If team is in 1st place
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName are in divisionRank place in the teamDivision with a record of teamRecord.

i.e.
The Yankees are in 1st place in the AL East with a record of 92-59

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND If team is Not in 1st place
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName are in divisionRank place in the teamDivision with a record of teamRecord.
They are gamesBack games behind the division-leading divisionLeader.

i.e.
The Yankees are in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 92-59.
They are 4 games behind the division-leading Red Sox.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND If date is after 8/1 & games back from 2nd wildcard is less than 5
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName are in divisionRank place in the teamDivision with a record of teamRecord.
They are gamesBack games behind the division-leading divisionLeader.
Currently, the teamName are wildCardGamesBack games out of the 2nd division Wild Card spot.

i.e.
The Yankees are in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 92-59.
They are 4 games behind the division-leading Red Sox.
Currently, the Yankees are 3 games out of the 2nd AL Wild Card spot.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND
If after a certain date, (Aug. 1?) should also include standings in the Wild Card race if a team is NOT in 1st place and within 5 games of 1 of the 2 league Wild Card spots. Say a team is 12 back in the NL East on Aug. 15 but only 2 back of a Wild Card spot.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is:

i.e.
The Yankees are in second place in the A L East with a record of 92-59. They are 8 games behind the division-leading Red Sox, 4 games behind the Twins for the first AL Wild Card spot, and 3 games behind 2 teams for the 2nd AL Wild Card spot.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: mlbatbat://standings?selectedTeams=nyy

title: Team Division Rank Off Season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: off-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for Team division rank

i.e. What PLACE are the Yankees in?

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for Team division rank
AND If team made playoffs
AND was not 1st in their division
AND did not win the world series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName finished the year regular season in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord.

They were the first/second Wild Card team in the league and advanced to the playoffRound, where they lost to the winningTeam gamesLost games to gamesWon.

i.e.
The New York Yankees finished the 2017 regular season in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 91-71.  

They were the 1st Wild Card team in the AL and advanced to the ALCS, where they lost to the Houston Astros 4 games to 3.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for Team division rank
AND If team made playoffs
AND won their division
AND did not win world series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName finished the year regular season in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord.

They lost to the winningTeam in the playoffRound gamesLost to gamesWon.

i.e.
The Washington Nationals finsihed the 2017 regular season in 1st place in the NL East with a record of 97-65.

They lost to the Chicago Cubs in the NLDS 3 games to 2.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for Team division rank
AND If team made playoffs
AND won their division
AND won the world series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName finished the year regular season in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord.

They won the World Series, where they defeated the losingTeam gamesWon games to gamesLost.

i.e.
The Houston Astros finished the 2017 regular season in 1st place in the AL West with a record of 101-61.

They won the World Series, where they defeated the Los Angeles Dodgers 4 games to 3.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for Team division rank
AND
If relevent, should also include info if the team made the playoffs. This would be an odd response if a team entered the postseason as a Wild Card and won the World Series, as an example. Also adding regular to season.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the response is:

i.e.
The New York Yankees finished the 2017 regular season in second place in the A L East with a record of 92-70. 

They were the first Wild Card team in the A L and advanced to the A L C S round, where they lost, 4 games to 3, to the Houston Astros.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: mlbatbat://standings?selectedTeams=nyy&state=divison

title: Team Division Rank in Specific Year
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: irrelevant
- season type: regular season
- year: 2012
- utterance tense: past
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a specific year

i.e. What PLACE did the Orioles finish in in 2012?

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a specific year
AND If team made playoffs
AND team was not 1st in their division
AND did not win the world series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName finished the year regular season in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord. 
They were the first/second Wild Card team in the league and advanced to the playoffRound, where they lost to the winningTeam gamesLost games to gamesWon.

i.e.
The Orioles finished the 2012 regular season in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 93-69.

They were the 2nd Wild Card team in the AL and advanced to the ALDS, where they lost to the Yankees 3 games to 2.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a specific year
AND If team made playoffs
AND if team won their division
AND did not win world series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName finished the year regular season in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord. 
They lost to the winningTeam in the playoffRound gamesLost to gamesWon.

i.e.
The Yankees finished the 2012 regular season in 1st place in the AL East with a record of 95-67.
They lost to the Detroit Tigers in the ALCS 4 games to 0.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a specific year
AND If team made playoffs
AND team won world series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName finished the year regular season in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord. 
They won the World Series, where they defeated the losingTeam gamesWon games to gamesLost.

i.e.
The Giants finsihed the 2012 regular season in 1st place in the NL West with a record of 94-68.
They won the World Series, where they defeated the Detroit Tigers 4 games to 0.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink ????
custom_steps_separated.expected: Is there a standings deep link for a specific year and team?

title: Team Division Rank responses
custom_preconds: GIVEN that as a baseball fan, I want to be able to ask BAMbot what place my favorite team is in
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank

i.e.
- What place are the Yankees in?
- How are the Mets doing this season?
- What is the Nationals record this year?
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be deep linked into the native standings view with the requested team(s) highlighted

(see deeplinks here: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55312411)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND the team is in 1st place
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

i.e.
The Yankees are in 1st place in the AL East with a record of 92-59.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND the team is in NOT in 1st place
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in the response a 2nd line should be added telling the user how many games back from 1st place the team is.

i.e. 
The Yankees are in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 92-59.
They are 4 games behind the division-leading Red Sox.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank 
AND the team is not in 1st place
AND the date is after 8/1 
AND they are less than 5 games back from the 2nd wild card spot
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in the response a 3rd line should be added telling the user how many games out of the wild card the team is.

i.e. 
The Yankees are in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 92-59.
They are 4 games behind the division-leading Red Sox.
Currently, the Yankees are 3 games out of the 2nd AL Wild Card spot.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND multiple teams are tied for first place
AND they have the same record
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in the response template should indicate which teams are tied and return their records

i.e.
The Pirates and Cardinals are tied for 1st place in the NL Central with records of 72-70.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND multiple teams are tied for first place
AND they have different records
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate which teams are tied but omit the records.

i.e.
The Yankees and Orioles are tied for 1st place in the AL East.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND multiple teams are tied, not in first place
AND they have the same record
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate which teams are tied and return their records

i.e. 
The Pirates and Cardinals are tied for 3rd place in the NL Central with records of 72-70.
They are 8 games behind the division-leading Cubs.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND multiple teams are tied, not in 1st place
AND they have different records
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate which teams are tied but omit the records

i.e. 
The Yankees and Orioles are tied for 3rd place in the AL East.
They are 4 games behind the division-leading Red Sox.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank
AND multiple teams are tied, not in 1st place, the date is after 8/1, 
AND they are less than 5 games back from the 2nd wild card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then in the response a 3rd line should be added indicating how many games back from the 2nd wild card the teams are

i.e. 
The Yankees and Orioles are tied for 3rd place in the AL East with records of 22-16.
They are 4 games behind the division-leading Red Sox.
Currently, the Yankees and Orioles are 3 games out of the 2nd AL Wild Card spot.

title: Team Division Rank in Specific Year responses
custom_preconds: GIVEN that as a baseball fan, I want to be able to ask BAMbot what place a specific team finished in for a certain year
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank

i.e.
- How did the Yankees do in 1985?
- How did the Nationals finish last year?
- What place did the Pirates finish in in 1897?
custom_expected: THEN the user should get a response in the following format / template

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a specific year
AND a 2nd Wild Card team was added (i.e. Orioles in 2012):
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN if a team made the wild card, the response / template is in the following format to reflect if they were the 1st or 2nd Wild Card team

i.e.
The Baltimore Orioles finished the 2012 regular season in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 93-69.
They were the second Wild Card team in the American League and advanced to the ALDS, where they lost to the New York Yankees 3 games to 2.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a specific year
AND there was a player strike (i.e. in 1994)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN if asking about standings when there was a player's strike, the response / template should indicate that no playoff games occurred that year if the team would have made the playoffs

i.e. 
The New York Yankees finished the 1994 regular season in 1st place in the AL East with a record of 70-43.
No MLB postseason games were played this year.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank in a between 1969 and present
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN in the response a division name and ranking should be present (AL East, NL East, etc)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank before 1969
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in the response just the league and ranking should be present (American League, National League)

i.e. 
The New York Yankees finished the 1967 regular season in 9th place in the American League with a record of 72-90.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user asks a query for team division rank before 1903
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN in the response template should indicate that no playoff games occurred that year

i.e.
The Philadelphia Athletics finished the 1902 regular season in 1st place in the American League with a record of 83-53.
No MLB postseason games were played this year.

title: Unspecified Team - Ranking in Division, Mid-Season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for an unspecified team - ranking in division

i.e. Who's in LAST PLACE in the AL EAST?
custom_expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName are in divisionRank place in the division with a record of teamRecord.

i.e. The Rays are in last place in the AL East with a record of 62-99.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: mlbatbat://standings

title: Unspecified Team - Ranking in Division, Spring Training
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: spring training
- season type: regular season
- year: previous year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for an unspecified team - ranking in division

i.e. Who's in LAST PLACE in the AL EAST?
custom_expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The year has not started yet, but the teamName finished in divisionRank in the teamDivision last year with a teamRecord regular season record.

i.e. The 2018 season has not started yet, but the Houston Astros finished in 1st place in the AL West last year with a 101-61 regular season record.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

title: Unspecified Team - Ranking in Spring Training League
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: spring training
- season type: spring training
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for an unspecified team - ranking in spring training league

i.e. Who is in FIRST PLACE in the CACTUS LEAGUE?
custom_expected:
THEN user is taken to the Standings page

* NOTE: This is fine as is for right now. Since we likely won't be "launching" (marketing the standings intent) until after opening day, we'll likely implement the text template sometime later on this season. We could leave this ticket SDBB-576 open for now but we won't be implementing a standings spring training template anytime soon.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content: NOT YET IMPLEMENTED: For Future Release after Opening Day
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName are in springLeagueRank place in the springLeague with a record of teamRecord.

i.e. The Cubs are in 1st place in the Cactus League with a record of 12-5.

title: Unspecified Team - Ranking in Division for a Specific Year / No Specific Year
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for an unspecified team - ranking in specific division for a specific year or no specific year mentioned

i.e. 

- Who is in first place in the AL East?
- Who finished in 2nd place in the NL Central in 2013?

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query with No year specified
AND the current season has not started yet

i.e. Who is in first place in the AL East?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate that the season has not started 
and fall back to the results from the previous year.

i.e. The 2018 season has not started yet, but the Boston Red Sox finished in 1st place in the AL East last year with a 93-69 regular season record.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user asks a query for a team which made the wild card (in 2012 - A 2nd Wild Card team was added)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should reflect if they were the 1st or 2nd Wild Card team. (i.e. Orioles in 2012)

i.e. 

The Baltimore Orioles finished the 2012 regular season in 2nd place in the AL East with a record of 93-69.

They were the second Wild Card team in the American League and advanced to the ALDS, where they lost to the New York Yankees 3 games to 2.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query about a team
AND there was a Player Strike that year (i.e. Player Strike occurred in 1994)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate that no playoff games occurred that year if the team would have made the playoffs

i.e. 

The New York Yankees finished the 1994 regular season in 1st place in the AL East with a record of 70-43.

No MLB postseason games were played this year.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user ask about a team between 1969 - Present
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the response template should indicate division name and ranking (AL East, NL East, etc).

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user ask about a team before 1969
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate just the league and ranking (American League, National League)

i.e. The New York Yankees finished the 1967 regular season in 9th place in the American League with a record of 72-90.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user ask about a team before the playoffs were implemented in 1903
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response template should indicate that no playoff games occured that year

i.e. 

The Philadelphia Athletics finished the 1902 regular season in 1st place in the American League with a record of 83-53.

No MLB postseason games were played this year.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user ask about a team in a specific division by ranking with no year (MLB divisions each have 5 teams so when you're asking divisional ranking questions, it should be 1-5)

i.e. Who finished in 4th place in the nl east?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be 

The 2018 season has not started yet, but the New York Mets finished in 4th place in the NL East last year with a 70-92 regular season record.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user ask about a team by ranking by AL, NL, or MLB with no year (AL/NL rankings currently would not exceed 15th place & MLB rankings currently would not exceed 30th place)

i.e. who finished in 11th place in the nl?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is taken to the standings page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user ask about a team in a specific division by ranking over 5th place with no year (MLB divisions each have 5 teams so when you're asking divisional ranking questions, it should be 1-5)

i.e. 

- who's 123rd
- who placed 200 before last
- who finished in 11th place in the nl east?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be an error message:

i.e. I'm having trouble looking up that standings information right now.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user ask about a team by ranking with no year
AND there is a two way tie (i.e. two way tie in 4th place)

i.e. Who's in 5th place?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the response should tell you about who's tied for 4th and 5th place

title: Ranking in the Division - Two Team Tie
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie
AND both teams are in first place
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName and teamName are tied for divisionRank in the division with records of teamRecord.

i.e. The Pirates and Cardinals are tied for 1st place in the NL Central with records of 72-70.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie
AND teams are not in first place

i.e. Who's in THIRD in the NL CENTRAL?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName and teamName are tied for divisionRank in the division with records of teamRecord.
They are gamesBack games behind the division-leading divisionLeader.

i.e. 
The Pirates and Cardinals are tied for third place in the NL Central with records of 72-70.
They are 8 games behind the division-leading Cubs.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie
AND If teams are not in 1st place
AND date is after 8/1
AND games back from 2nd wildcard is less than 5

i.e. Who's in THIRD in the NL CENTRAL?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName and teamName are tied for divisionRank in the division with records of teamRecord.
They are gamesBack games behind the division-leading divisionLeader.
Currently, the teamName and teamName are wildCardGamesBack games out of the 2nd division Wild Card spot.

i.e.

The Pirates and Cardinals are tied for 3rd place in the NL Central with records of 72-70.
They are 8 games behind the division-leading Cubs.
Currently, the Pirates and Cardinals are 3 games out of the 2nd NL Wild Card spot

custom_steps_separated.content: NEEDS REVIEW
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Would add logic to provide context on how far out of the playoff race they are from Aug. 1 forward. This may be the reason the question is being asked, rather than just wanting the raw record.

i.e. 
The Pirates and Cardinals are tied for third place in the N L Central with records of 72 and 70. They are eight games behind the division-leading Cubs, four games behind the Mets for the first NL Wild Card spot and 3 games behind the Dodgers for the second NL WIld Card spot.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie
AND teams are both in first place

i.e. What place are the Yankees in?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName and teamName are tied for divisionRank in the division with records of teamRecord.

i.e. The Yankees and Orioles are tied for 1st place in the A L East with records of 22 and 16.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie
AND teams are not in first place

WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division
AND there is a two team tie
AND teams are not in first place
AND date is after 8/1
AND games back from 2nd wildcard is less than 5

i.e. What place are the Yankees in?
i.e. What place are the Yankees in?

THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName and teamName are tied for divisionRank in the division with records of teamRecord.
They are gamesBack games behind the division-leading divisionLeader.
Currently, the teamName and teamName are wildCardGamesBack games out of the 2nd division Wild Card spot.

title: Ranking in the Division - Two Team Time, Off Season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

WHEN the user asks a query for ranking in the division

title: Team Records
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps: WHEN the user asks team record queries

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for best team record

i.e. 
Who has the best record?
Who has the best record in baseball?
Who has the best record in MLB?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName currently have the best record in baseball with a mark of teamRecord

i.e. The Nationals currently have the best record in baseball with a mark of 45-20.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for worst team record

i.e. 
Who has the worst record?
Who has the worst record in baseball?
Who has the worst record in MLB?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName currently have the worst record in baseball with a mark of teamRecord

i.e. The Mets currently have the worst record in baseball with a mark of 20-30.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for best team record in american league

i.e.
Who has the best record in the AL?
Who has the best record in the American League?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName currently have the best record in the league with a mark of teamRecord

i.e. The Yankees currently have the best record in the American League with a mark of 56-24.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for best team record in national league

i.e. Who has the best record in the NL East?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName currently have the best record in the division with a mark of teamRecord

i.e. The Nationals currently have the best record in the NL East with a mark of 45-20.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for worst team record in national league

i.e. Who has the worst record in the NL East?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The teamName currently have the worst record in the division with a mark of teamRecord

i.e. The Mets currently have the worst record in the NL East with a mark of 20-30.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for how many games back, games out of first (place), or games behind
AND if requested team is in first place

i.e.
How many games back are the Mets?
How many games out of first (place) are the Mets?
How many games behind are the Mets?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The requestedTeamName, with a record of requestedTeamRecord, are currently in 1st place in the division, with a gameLead game lead over the secondPlaceTeam.

i.e. The Nationals, with a record of 28-20, are currently in 1st place in the NL East with a 2 game lead over the Mets.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query for how many games back, games out of first (place), or games behind
AND if requested team is NOT in first place

i.e.
How many games back are the Mets?
How many games out of first (place) are the Mets?
How many games behind are the Mets?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:

The requestedTeamName, with a record of requestedTeamRecord, are currently gamesBack games back from the first place firstPlaceTeam in the division. 
They are firstWildCardGamesBack games back of the firstWildCardTeam for the first division Wild Card spot and secondWildCardGamesBack games back of the secondWildCardTeam for the second division Wild Card spot.

i.e.
The Mets, with a record of 20-35, are currently 6.5 games back from the 1st place Nationals in the NL East. They are 5 games back of the Cubs for the 1st NL Wild Card spot and 3 games back of the D-backs for the 2nd NL Wild Card spot.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
The user asks a query for team record by games

i.e. How many games back are the Mets?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The teamName (record) are currently gamesBack games back from the first place firstPlaceTeam (record) in the division
{{if in first place}}
The teamName (record) are currently in first place in the division.

i.e. The Mets (20 - 35) are currently 6.5 games back from the first place Nationals (28 - 20) in the NL East.
The Nationals (28 - 20) are currently in first place in the NL East.

i.e. How many games out of first (place) are the Mets?

{{if in first place}}
The teamName (record) are currently in first place in the division.

i.e. The Mets (20 - 35) are currently 6.5 games back from the first place Nationals (28 - 20) in the NL East.
The Nationals (28 - 20) are currently in first place in the NL East.

i.e. The Mets (20 - 35) are currently 6.5 games back from the first place Nationals (28 - 20) in the NL East.
